title: Keep getting a "can't compact folder, no disk space" mesage.
content:
I keep getting a pop up that says: "Some folders (e.g. 'All Mail on piper@colbrook.com') cannot be compacted because there is not enough free disk space."

My C drive is pretty full, but I just added a large external hard drive. Here are my questions: Can I transfer my cache to that drive? Will that fix the problem? If so, how do I do it?

Thanks!
creator: piper1

title: Thunderbird freezes
content:
I keep getting a message "Item changed on server" with two buttons to press.It relates to one change I made to my Calendar in December 2022. If it appears when I first switch on, I can shut it down but later on it often freezes and I can't use either button. I have to go into task manager and shut Thunderbird down. This happens at least once a day.

How can I solve this permanently?

title: Always trying to compact but fails because other actions going on
content: Frequently when Thunderbird asks to compact a folder, if I click yes, it'll immediately fail because it's currently doing something else. Seem like bad design. Would seem better if it, for example, asked only when nothing else was going on or added the compacting action to an action queue so it was conflicting with itself.
creator: sonofthe

title: Thunderbird/Profile File
content:
Weds. 4.26.2023

Hi,

My Computer: Lenovo T490 OS Name: Microsoft Windows 10 Pro Version: 10.0.19045 Thunderbird client 102.10.1 (64-bit)

From a previously owned PC computer, I have a folder on my T490 computer desktop, that contains the folders from the following directory C:\Users\dmitt\AppData\Roaming\Thunderbird

The Thunderbird ( 25MBytes) folder contains the following folders: Crash Reports Pending Pings Profiles install.ini

I “understand” that above Profiles folder contains emails, contacts and Address books data. How do I Import the "old" Profile file data to my Thunderbird client connected to a Cornell University iMap server ?

Please send email to Dan Mittler dm68@cornell.edu or call 607 227.7393

Thank you.
creator: dm68

title: Thunderbird Has Become Very Slow & Unresponsive
content:
I'm using Thunderbird 102.10.1 64 Bit on Windows 10 Pro 10.0.19044 build 19044 & Thunderbird has become very slow & unresponsive when I'm using it. Everything has slowed down: typing is very bad, opening & closing windows, sending message, receiving messages.

I have already tried shutting off global search & indexer and hardware acceleration, but that hasn't helped. I've tried uninstalling it completely & then reinstalling it as well. I have no extensions or add-ons installed, either. This started happening within the last few weeks.

Is there something I'm missing?

Thanks!
creator: dreamspinner3

title: one of my sent emails is now showing in TB 102.10.1 (64 bit) as plain text rather than HTML
content:
I have tried checking View>Message Body as> which is showing as Original HTML. Changing this makes no difference, whether Simple HTML or Plain Text.

I tried Repair text encoding as a long shot, but no difference.

The same message, viewed in Outlook, shows the HTML format OK.

Not sure how to fix this

The message details show as below, if this is helpful?

It appears to be limited to this one email.
creator: billhague

title: All Trash Messages over 3 Weeks Old are Missing
content:
I've used Thunderbird IMAP forever. Probably 20 years. I just went to retrieve a 4-month-old message from my Trash file and found all messages beyond 3 weeks ago were gone. "Empty Trash on Exit" is NOT checked (never has been, ever). "When I Delete a Message: Move it to Trash" is selected. Always has been. I've never manually removed Trash messages. I was wondering if maybe my mobile phone was able to change the Trash retention settings, but I see no control for that on Samsung's mail server, so I assume that's not possible from the phone.

Frustrating. I really need a message from 3 months ago. What did I do wrong?
creator: jl11

title: Malfunzionamento Thunderbird
content:
Buongiorno,

da inizio anno fino ad un mese ho sempre utilizzato Thunderbird tramite ExQuilla, purtroppo da 1 mese circa a questa parte ogni volta che apro l'applicazione non mi da la possibilità di mandare mail ma soprattutto mi carica solamente la cartella "A".

In allegato un immagine per far capire di che cosa parlo.

Attendo Vostre.

Spero di essere stato chiaro nella spiegazione.

Cordiali saluti
creator: riccardo.amato
